advanced/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
advanced/congratulations.description: You have just completed the setup of your panel! Now you can monitering licenses, plans, passes, and creating purchase links.

advanced/entry-point.title: Entry Point
advanced/entry-point.description: Let's setup our entry point for our project.

advanced/folder-structure.title: Folder Structure
advanced/folder-structure.description: After we have initialized our project and installed our modules, we will need to create our folder structure.

advanced/modal.title: User Schema
advanced/modal.description: Now that we have setup our MongoDB database, let's create our User Schema.

advanced/passport.title: Passport Setup
advanced/passport.description: Now that we have setup our schemas and our sessions we will go into the core of authentication, `PassportJs`.

advanced/routes.title: Express Routes
advanced/routes.description: We have now setup our MongoDB database, our schemas and our sessions, now we will setup our routes.

advanced/setup.title: Enviroment Setup
advanced/setup.description: Congratulations! You have successfully understood how the Whop API works and how to do basic functions, let's start now with our Advanced Guide.

advanced/views.title: Views Folder
advanced/views.description: Now all that is left to do is to create our `views folder, this is where we will store all of our ejs` files.

advanced/whop.title: Whop Functions
advanced/whop.description: Now that we have built our entry points lets work on creating our Whop Functions for the panel.

authorization-difference.title: Authorization Difference
authorization-difference.description: What is the difference between the bearer token and the client ID?

beginner/congratulations.title: Congratulations!
beginner/congratulations.description: You have just learned the basics of Whop API.

beginner/enviroment-setup.title: Enviroment Setup
beginner/enviroment-setup.description: First we will need to create our main JS file, we will call it `index.js`.

beginner/license-metadata.title: License MetaData
beginner/license-metadata.description: The license metadata is a JSON object that can be used to store any information you want, this can be used to store the HWID of the device that the license is being used on, the IP address, the location, etc.

beginner/license-object.title: License Object
beginner/license-object.description: Now that we have setup our enviroment to work with the Whop API, let's get started by understanding the licesne object that is returned.

beginner/validating-the-license-key.title: Validating the License Key
beginner/validating-the-license-key.description: There are two ways to validate the license key, the first one is to use the `validate method from the API and the second one is to validate from the license object itself using the valid` property.
